agent_1.role: Operator for small and medium-small disks
private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk, and only move the top disk of a peg
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal moves involving disks A..H to achieve the target configuration with B on the right peg and all other disks on the left peg in the specified order.

agent_2.role: Operator for medium-large and large disks
private_information: I can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk, and only move the top disk of a peg
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal moves involving disks I..O if necessary; avoid unnecessary moves to reach the target configuration efficiently.

private_information: I verify that the sequence of moves respects Tower of Hanoi legality, agent-specific permissions, and maintains causally valid preconditions at every step
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties) and ensure the final sequence is the minimal necessary to achieve the specified goal
auditor.goal: Validate the move sequence for legality, agent assignment compliance, and correctness against the initial and goal configurations; return a cleaned, justified sequence.

private_information: I integrate agents' plans and the auditor's report
I output a final PDDL domain and problem that target the FastDownwards solver, capturing agent-specific move capabilities and the exact initial and goal states
orchestrator.goal: Produce a multi-agent aware Tower of Hanoi PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownwards that replicates the validated plan and achieves the goal configuration.

public_information: Task: 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest)
Agents are restricted: agent_1 may move A..H; agent_2 may move I..O
Initial configuration: left peg has top->bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle and right pegs are empty
Goal configuration: left peg has top->bottom A,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg empty; right peg has top->bottom B
Rules: move one disk at a time; only move the top disk from a peg; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; respect agent-specific disk permissions
Requested output: an ordered list of primitive moves using the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
solution.justification: Move A off B to free B; move B to target peg; return A onto left peg above C to match the goal ordering; no large disks need to be moved so agent_2 remains idle

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can only move disks A..H while obeying Tower of Hanoi rules; propose only the minimal necessary legal moves you can perform to help achieve the goal.
local_plan.prompt: Using the public information and your private permissions, produce the smallest correct sequence of primitive moves you can execute, formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'; avoid moves involving disks I..O and avoid redundant steps; cross-check your sequence achieves the goal when combined with other agents.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can only move disks I..O while obeying Tower of Hanoi rules; propose moves only if they are strictly necessary to achieve the goal.
local_plan.prompt: Using the public information and your private permissions, return an empty plan if no moves are required, otherwise provide primitive moves formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' and ensure every move is legal and necessary.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor; check temporal/causal consistency, Tower of Hanoi legality, and agent-specific permissions; remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure the final sequence is the minimal necessary to achieve the stated goal.
audit.prompt: Given the initial and goal configurations and the two agents' proposed move lists, validate that each move is legal and that preconditions hold at each step; ensure agent_1 moves only A..H and agent_2 only I..O; prefer the minimal correct plan; output a cleaned, justified sequence and a brief validation summary; if the minimal 3-move sequence achieves the goal, select it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning; produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver; encode pegs, disks A..O, size ordering, on/top relations, clear status, and legal move action schemas restricted per-agent (agent_1 for A..H and agent_2 for I..O); ensure the initial and goal states match the given instance; enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the agents' plans and the auditor's report to generate a consistent Tower of Hanoi PDDL model for FastDownwards; ensure the domain supports agent-qualified move actions or typed operators enforcing disk-permission constraints; include objects for pegs and all disks, predicates for on, clear, smaller, holding-free if needed, and define an initial state matching the left peg stack A..O with others empty and a goal state with left peg A,C..O and right peg B; keep agent actions distinct in the operator names or parameter typing; return only the domain and problem enclosed in the required tags followed by no commentary; inputs follow: plan_agent_1={plan_agent_1}; plan_agent_2={plan_agent_2}; audit_report={audit_report}.
